newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Bozano to buy insurance company - report.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Bozano to buy insurance company - report.

text.p: Brazilian investment bank Bozano, Simonsen is expected to announce Tuesday it has bought local insurance company Oceanica Seguros, local news agency Invest News said.
The insurance sector is one of the most promising financial areas in the country as has been proved by other companies linked to the banking sector, Invest News said.
In the case of Bradesco bank, 354 million reais ($334 million) of Bradesco's 1996 profit of more than 800 million reais ($755 million) was due to its insurance business, it added.
Bozano, Simonsen spokesmen could not be reached for comment on the report. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
